p.s: Description of Ignicoccus islandicus sp. nov. (Huber, Burggraf, Mayer and Stetter)
Ignicoccus islandicus (is.lan'di.cus. M.L. masc. adj. islandicus Icelandic, pertaining to the location of its
Slightly irregular cocci, about 1.2-3 μm in diameter, monopolar polytrichous flagella.
No evidence for a regular arrayed surface protein.
Growth between 70 and 98 °C, pH 3.8-6.5 and 0.3-5.5% NaCl; optima are 90 °C, pH 5.8 and 2% NaCl.
Chemolithoautotrophic growth in the presence ofH2 and CO2 with sulfur as electron acceptor.
No chemo-organotrophic growth on meat extract, yeast extract, peptone, Casamino acids, gelatin, starch, formate, acetate and glucose.
Sulfate, sul®te, thiosulfate, nitrate and oxygen are not used as electron acceptors.
H2S (up to 25 μmol ml-1) is formed during growth.
Growth stimulated by addition of 0.1% meat extract, tryptone or gelatin.
Low DNA-DNA similarity to Ignicoccus paci®cus.
Type strain is isolate Kol8T (=DSM 13165T=ATCC 700957T), isolated from the Kolbeinsey Ridge, north of Iceland.
